definitions.example: He found himself guilty of prodigal spending during the holidays.

definitions.definition: (often followed by of or with) Yielding profusely, lavish.
definitions.example: How can he be so prodigal with money on such a tight budget?

definitions.definition: (by allusion to the Biblical parable of the prodigal son) returning after abandoning a person, group, or ideal, especially for selfish reasons; behaving as a prodigal son.
